section.heading: Scope.
section.text: These regulations pertain to all programs for English Learners (ELs) that provide instructional assistance and services to enable ELs to attain English proficiency, develop high levels of academic language, and achieve at high levels in academic subjects so that all ELs can meet the same challenging Maryland College and Career Ready Standards that all students are expected to meet.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Home language survey" means one or more questions posed to all parents and students upon entering a local school system in order to determine the language or languages spoken in the home.
“English Learner” means a student:
Who communicates in a language other than English; or
Whose family uses a primary language other than English in the home; and
Whose English language proficiency falls within the range established by the State for an English language development program.

Each local school system shall establish an English language development program for those students who have been identified as ELs by means of a home language survey as well as the State-approved English language proficiency placement assessment.
The English language development programs shall contain the following components:
Goals;
Student identification;
Student placement;
Curriculum and instruction;
Certified English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) teachers;
Materials of instruction;
Facilities;
Program delivery models;
Parent and community involvement;
Support services;
Exit criteria; and
Program evaluation.
A student who has been identified as an EL shall:
Be placed in an English language development program; and
Be evaluated each year on the State-approved summative English language proficiency assessment in listening, speaking, reading, and writing to determine EL status.
The English language development program shall include the following standards:
English language learners communicate for Social and Instructional purposes within the school setting.
English language learners communicate information, ideas, and concepts necessary for academic success in the content area of Language Arts.
English language learners communicate information, ideas, and concepts necessary for academic success in the content area of Mathematics.
English language learners communicate information, ideas, and concepts necessary for academic success in the content area of Science.
English language learners communicate information, ideas, and concepts necessary for academic success in the content area of Social Studies.
Local school systems shall adopt policies and procedures to ensure that there is an English language development program and that the program meets the requirements of this chapter.

section.heading: Funding.
section.text: The amount of State funding shall be determined annually on the basis of the number of ELs who are reported on the Enrollment Survey as of October 31.

section.heading: Reporting Requirements.
section.text: Local school systems shall annually report to the Department their goals, objectives, and strategies regarding the performance of English learners along with timelines for implementation and methods for measuring progress.
